conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway 3D dollhouse-style model with visible wall height/thickness and shaded vertical faces; view is mostly top-down but still shows vertical wall surfaces and depth.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; cutaway is clean. Camera is only mildly angled (close to top-down), reducing isometric depth cues.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (central living/dining core, kitchen bottom-left, bedrooms left/top and right, bath/utility cluster along top). Minor proportional differences and some partition/opening placements appear slightly simplified vs the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture blocks present and placed logically: sofas/TV in living, dining table centered, beds in bedrooms, kitchen counters/appliances, and bathroom fixtures visible.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable with consistent materials; interior is visible with adequate lighting. Slight softness/blur and limited contrast reduce fine opening readability.

detected_errors.description: Some room proportions/partition lengths appear simplified compared to the 2D plan, especially around the top-center service/bath corridor area.
Not all door/window locations and sizes can be confirmed as exact matches; several openings look generalized in the 3D model.
Rendering softness reduces precision when verifying small elements (doors/windows) and tight partitions.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and furnishings, but with a near top-down camera and minor simplifications in partitions/openings versus the 2D plan.
